A company has gathered data on the salaries and years of experience of their employees. The data set includes 50 employees. The company wants to group the employees based on their salaries and years of experience. Use cluster analysis to group the data into three clusters. 

The data set is available in a CSV file named "employee_data.csv" which contains two columns: "salary" and "years_of_experience". Write a Python code that reads this file and groups the employees into three clusters using k-means clustering algorithm.
message_2:
To perform k-means clustering on the given data, we will use the pandas library to read the CSV file and the scikit-learn library to perform the clustering. Here's the Python code to achieve this:

```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the CSV file
data = pd.read_csv("employee_data.csv")

# Extract the columns "salary" and "years_of_experience"
X = data[["salary", "years_of_experience"]]

# Perform k-means clustering with 3 clusters
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=3, random_state=0).fit(X)

# Assign the cluster labels to the data
data["cluster"] = kmeans.labels_

# Print the grouped data
print(data)

# Plot the clusters
plt.scatter(data["salary"], data["years_of_experience"], c=data["cluster"], cmap="viridis")
plt.xlabel("Salary")
plt.ylabel("Years of Experience")
plt.title("Employee Clustering")
plt.show()
```

This code reads the "employee_data.csv" file, extracts the "salary" and "years_of_experience" columns, and performs k-means clustering with 3 clusters. The resulting cluster labels are added to the data, and the data is printed. Finally, the clusters are visualized using a scatter plot.
